intro: Thysanoglossa jordanensis, commonly known as the Jordanian thysanoglossa, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of Jordan. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and fern-like leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and limited water availability. Due to its restricted habitat and vulnerability to environmental changes, it is considered a threatened species. Its unique botanical features make it an important subject for ecological and botanical research in arid ecosystems.
